dilution_instructions: Mix 1-2 oz per gallon of water

manufacturer_instructions: Mix 1 capful (2 tsp) per gallon of water
dilution_instructions: Mix 2 tsp per gallon of water

manufacturer_instructions: Insecticide for control of whiteflies, mealy bugs, armyworms, hornworms, leafhoppers, bagworms, leafminers, psyllids, fruit flies, loopers, budworms, beetles, aphids, scales, caterpillars, midges, and mites. Use on roses, flowers, houseplants, ornamental trees and shrubs, fruits, nuts, and vegetables. Apply at first sign of insects/mites on 7-14 day schedule. For heavy insect populations apply on 7-day schedule. Spray to run off with complete coverage of all plant tissue.
notes: Bonide Captain Jack's Neem Oil (Ready to Use)

manufacturer_instructions: Controls common fungal diseases including downy mildew, black rot, leaf spot, powdery mildew, blight, and peach leaf curl. Shake well, attach to garden hose and apply thoroughly to tops and undersides of leaves and all plant surfaces. Repeat every 7-10 days as needed. Can be used up to day of harvest. Approved for organic gardening.
notes: Bonide Captain Jack's Copper Fungicide (Ready to Spray)

manufacturer_instructions: Contains Spinosad derived from naturally occurring soil bacterium. Controls caterpillars and other listed insects. Does not significantly impact beneficial insects, predatory mites, and spiders. Shake well before use. Apply directly from container as thin, uniform film to tops and undersides of leaves. Apply when wind is light or absent (early morning or evening). Repeat applications as needed per label. For trees taller than 6 ft use concentrate with sprayer equipment.
notes: Bonide Captain Jack's DeadBug (Ready to Use)
Terro Cobweb Eliminator (Ready to Spray)

common_name: Brown Raised Bed - Stake 1 of 4 (1.5' × 2' each)
suitable_for_plants: tomatoes (indeterminate + compact indeterminate + determinate; 1 plant per stake section)
cherry/grape tomatoes (indeterminate; 1 plant per stake section)
tomatillos (1 plant per stake section; needs strong staking/cage)
cucumbers (slicing, pickling, Persian, Armenian; 1 plant per stake section)
pole beans (4-6 plants per stake section)
yardlong beans/asparagus beans (4-6 plants per stake section)
peas (snap peas, snow peas, shelling peas; cool season)
vining zucchini/zucchini trained vertically (1 plant; support + pruning)
vining summer squash trained vertically (1 plant; support + pruning)
winter squash (butternut, acorn, delicata, kabocha) trained vertically (1 plant; heavy support + slings)
pumpkins (mini/small varieties only) trained vertically (1 plant; heavy support + slings)
melons (small varieties only: sugar baby watermelon, cantaloupe, honeydew) trained vertically (1 plant; heavy support + slings)
sweet potatoes trained vertically (vine trellis) - foliage trained up, tubers in bed (1-2 slips per stake section)
bitter melon (1 plant; climbs aggressively, loves heat)
loofah/luffa gourd (1 plant; vigorous climber, needs strong trellis)
bottle gourd (1 plant; vigorous climber, needs strong trellis)
tromboncino squash (climbing summer squash; 1 plant; excellent vertical squash option)
climbing nasturtium (edible; trained up support; can be companion but still staked)
Malabar spinach (vining spinach substitute; 1 plant; climbs well in heat)
vining passionfruit (if you ever want a perennial vine; heavy support, long-term commitment)
notes: EMSCO Raised Bed Garden Bed Boards, 4 x 4 Feet configured as 2'L × 6'W × 5 inch D with 4 evenly distributed stakes, purchased at Lowe's. STAKED/TRAINED ONLY - all plants require vertical support
